command.name: scs-update
command.summary: Simple channel server: Update all releases of a within the get/ directory.
command.doc:
This command scans all existing .tar and .tgz files within the get/ directory, and then uses them to re-generate the REST files in the rest/ directory.
It must be executed from the channel root directory, the directory must contain the get/ directory with all releases, and must contain channel.xml.
In addition, the handle configuration variable must be set to your handle

command.name: scs-create
command.summary: Simple channel server: Create a channel.xml, get/ and rest/ directory for a channel

argument.name: name
argument.doc: Name of the channel to create. This should be the full name, such as pear2.php.net or pear.example.com/path

argument.name: alias
argument.doc: Channel alias, such as pear2 for pear2.php.net

argument.name: file
argument.doc: full path to the channel.xml to create. Default is channel.xml in the working directory

command.doc: This command creates a new channel in the current directory, or the directory specified by the location of the channel.xml file.

command.name: scs-add-maintainer
command.summary: Simple Channel Server: Add a new maintaing developer to the channel

argument.name: handle
argument.doc: Developer handle as used in package.xml

command.doc: This command adds a developer to the channel, and is useful for adding developers to be listed prior to making their first release.

command.name: scs-add-category
command.summary: Simple Channel Server: Add a new category to the channel

argument.name: category
argument.doc: Name of the category. This may contain spaces (use "" to contain them)

argument.name: description
argument.doc: Short description of the category's packages

command.doc: Categories are used to organize channels with large numbers of packages. Use this command to create a new category.

command.name: scs-categorize
command.summary: Simple Channel Server: Categorize a package

argument.name: package
argument.doc: Package to add to the category

argument.name: category
argument.doc: Name of the category. This may contain spaces (use "" to contain them)

command.doc: Use this command to add a package to a category.

command.name: scs-release
command.summary: Simple Channel Server: Release a package
command.doc: Release a package. This command uses the handle configuration variable as the releasing maintainer's handle, and generates REST files for the release in the rest/ directory as well as the released tarballs in the get/ directory.
